meanings.sent1: I harken to the birds chirping outside my window.

meanings.sent3: If you harken closely, you might hear the whispers of the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her heart harkened to the call of the ocean waves.
meanings.sent5: Harken to the sound of the falling rain, it speaks softly.

meanings.sent1: Harken to the warning signs along the road.
meanings.sent2: It is important to harken when crossing the street.

meanings.sent5: Harken to the advice of the wise owl perched on the branch.

meanings.sent1: I always harken to the sound of my mother's voice.
meanings.sent2: The dog would harken to its owner's commands.
meanings.sent3: The cat refused to harken to the call of its name.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins harkened to the stories of the past.
meanings.sent5: Harken to the melody of the violin, it sings a sweet tune.

meanings.sent1: The loyal knight would always harken to the king's orders.
meanings.sent2: Children should harken to their parents' guidance.
